sub_topic: Show that every group of order 27 is isomorphic to either the cyclic group C27 or the non-abelian group of order 27.
message_1: Let G be a group of order 27. Find the number of elements of G of order 3 and use this information to determine whether G is isomorphic to the cyclic group C27 or the non-abelian group of order 27.

The order of H is 9, and since 9 is a prime power (3^2), H is a p-group and therefore has a non-trivial center. Let Z(H) denote the center of H. Since Z(H) is non-trivial, it must have order 3 or 9.

In this case, Z(H) is a subgroup of H of order 3, and since H is a subgroup of G, Z(H) is also a subgroup of G. Thus, we have found a subgroup of G of order 3. In conclusion, we can determine whether G is isomorphic to the cyclic group C27 or the non-abelian group of order 27 by finding the number of elements of G of order 3. If there are exactly 9 elements of order 3, then G is isomorphic to C27. If there are fewer than 9 elements of order 3, then G is the non-abelian group of order 27.
